intro: Cinchona cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved quinine tree, is a species native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain the seeds, and it is known for its medicinal properties, particularly the presence of quinine in its bark. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks.
